persistent.sfs

Identical placements except in a polar orbit.

Edited August 13, 2014 by Spartwo

Battle Update!

At KSC, a scout bike maneuvers in to fire on one of the Panther IIs. It expended all three shots at the back, hoping to score a lucky hit on the cockpit. Sadly, none did. The extent of the damage was one small plate knocked off the rear armor.

In space, the Spade is technically alive, but is missing half of its electricity generation and is horribly unbalanced. I'm going to call it dead.

A Shepler destroyer moves in to score a preemptive strike against the Hydra.

It fires its dual SRBs at the rear engines, hoping to take them out.

Only one engine was destroyed, but some armor was knocked off. Since the mini rockets are less accurate, I moved to the side and fired the rest of my shots into the side of the beast. It looks like nothing important was broken. The Hydra still stands ominously... (love the eclipse + red targeting lights combo in this screenshot).

The Shepler, out of weapons, retreated to an 800km orbit. Things aren't looking good for me so far... PERSISTENT

And, I have a more faithful F/A-18 Super hornet. Drop tank and weapons officer included. (Missiles were upgraded to actual AIM-9X specs. I forgot to put in the second pilot in some of the screenshots, but it has a second cockpit along with extremely good low speed handling).

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I think it could come in handy in ground battles. Once multiplayer gets released, anyone want to dogfight me? :)

Edited August 13, 2014 by andrew123
I'll give it a go.

I fired all 3 shots from my fighter into the Javelin. First two hit and now there's not much left of the poor ship.

Did discover a flaw with my fighter though. Each shot I fire sends it into a spin and it veers off course unless all the shots have been fired. :/

Sorry for the night pics.

It will be interesting to see what happens to this thread when multiplayer is added.

Battle Update!

At KSC, a scout bike maneuvers in to fire on one of the Panther IIs. It expended all three shots at the back, hoping to score a lucky hit on the cockpit. Sadly, none did. The extent of the damage was one small plate knocked off the rear armor.

http://i.imgur.com/X6idzSk.png

In space, the Spade is technically alive, but is missing half of its electricity generation and is horribly unbalanced. I'm going to call it dead.

A Shepler destroyer moves in to score a preemptive strike against the Hydra.

http://i.imgur.com/Jih6yNo.png

It fires its dual SRBs at the rear engines, hoping to take them out.

http://i.imgur.com/8XUfr0B.png

Only one engine was destroyed, but some armor was knocked off. Since the mini rockets are less accurate, I moved to the side and fired the rest of my shots into the side of the beast. It looks like nothing important was broken. The Hydra still stands ominously... (love the eclipse + red targeting lights combo in this screenshot).

http://i.imgur.com/BVFNgSS.png

The Shepler, out of weapons, retreated to an 800km orbit. Things aren't looking good for me so far... PERSISTENT

Mobilized an unused Panther II to attack the Heavy Tank

Unfortunately it took two shots instead of the previous one shot to disable the tank, as the first shot went low and bounced of the sides at an oblique angle.

The end result was the same as last time, the capsule has separated.

Rendezvous with the Shepler

I only got one good hit on the Shepler, the rest of the shots missed due to the Hydra being unbalanced and difficulty in stabilizing the trajectory.

I knocked off one of the engines and both command pods.

It should be reasonably difficult to maneuver now.

Afterwards I expended the rest of the fuel establishing an eccentric orbit.

http://www.filedropper.com/persistent_5

Anyone want a land battle?
Built a tank but the rockets do well... nothing. :/
Arrr, I'll have to limit my parts to something below 350 then as most of my tanks are 350+ parts wise
Suspension isn't it?

Suspension isn't it?

Yes suspension boosts the parts count right up, a problem I've sort of made better as time goes on, hopefully the new suspensions will be less part requiring, but they are necessary as I do believe that the panther 2 uses my suspension for its design, correct me if I'm wrong but yes it makes the wheels less prone to breaking by 100%in fact
On a tank it doesn't matter as much if a single wheel breaks as people make the treads from 5 or so per side.

On a tank it doesn't matter as much if a single wheel breaks as people make the treads from 5 or so per side.

5 wheels you say, my Jagdtiger has 24 Wheels in total including front idlers, the drive wheels are in fact made of xenon tanks and a docking port. Here are some piccys
